page.title: 13RELIGION
page.content: Stamford has long been noted for its wealth of churches. Today, in 1985, there are six Anglican churches(see p.14) as well as a Roman Catholic church, Methodist church, Free church, United Reformed church, Baptist church, Salvation Army citadel and Pentecostal church. Divine healing services and 'Glory' meetings take place on occasions. Besides the recognised Christian Churches there is a thriving Jehovahs Witness group, a branch of the Mormon church and the Christadelphians. Through the Stamford Council of Churches an ecumerical mission was held in 1984 for the whole town. Christian church groups regularly join together for united services and other events, including the Stamford Festival in July. Christianity is very much a part of Stamfords rich heritage
